alert.note: Alert for Martin; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 1:04AM EST until February 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Johnson and Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Floyd, Magoffin and Morgan. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 103 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain falling from showers moving across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Salyersville, Inez, Mason, Warfield, Collista, Fitz, East Point, Denver, Hagerhill, Patrick, Leander, Oaklawn Estates, West Van Lear, Dobson, Bays Branch, Van Lear, Auxier and Thealka.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
